title: 智能燈柱資料收集官方回應

replies.msg:
我發電郵去創新科技局問 啱啱收到回覆

According to news sources that Smart Lamp Poles with video surveillance capability are being installed in various area including MTR stations. I would like to inquire about the following

1. Is Facial recognition technology being deployed with those video cameras?
2. Is walking gaits or other biometric data also collected from video camera?
3. How long is the video being stored?
4. Can HK citizen opt-out for his or her biometric data being collected?
5. Will any public consultation be planned on usage and collection of biometric data from Smart Lamp Pole.
6. With HK shopping malls such as New Town Center in Shatin deploying facial recognition, As a EU citizen, How do i ensure corporation like SHK enforce "the right to be forgotten" ordinance under GDPR
回覆呢

官方回覆

The HKSAR Government is pursuing the “Multi-functional Smart Lampposts” pilot scheme, under which some 400 smart lampposts would be installed in four districts in Hong Kong. The aim is to promote smart city development and supporting 5G mobile network implementation.

Under the current planning, only three types of city data will be collected via the smart lampposts to enhance city and traffic management services of relevant departments, they are meteorological data, air quality data and traffic snapshot images in low resolution. Data collected will only be transmitted to relevant government departments (i.e. Hong Kong Observatory, Environmental Protection Department and Transport Department), and will also at the same time be uploaded as open data to the Public Sector Information (PSI) Portal (data.gov.hk) for free access by the public and the industry to promote development of more innovative applications. All data will be deleted immediately after transmission and will not be stored in the lampposts.

The smart lampposts do not carry any facial recognition function and no walking gaits or other biometric data will be collected.

Under the scheme, all smart lampposts will be installed on public roads/streets and none will be installed in MTR Stations or shopping malls. We have released the locations, functions and equipment of the 50 smart lampposts which have been installed so far, and also published them as open data on PSI Portal for public reference. The aim is to enable the public to have an objective and better understanding of the functions and applications of the lampposts. These 50 lampposts are now in place on Sheung Yuet Road in Kowloon Bay and Shing Kai Road in Kai Tak and in the Kwun Tong city centre. Information on any new batch of smart lampposts to be installed or functions to be added to the lampposts in future will also be released to the public with the same level of transparency.

Furthermore, we will also continue to brief the Legislative Council on the progress of the scheme, and consult relevant District Councils before installing the remaining 350 or so lampposts.

Thank you very much for your questions.
